Reviews.Title: “Nice charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenny L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location. Across the street from the Louvre, a doable walk to Notre Dame, and we took a quick taxi to the Eiffel Tower from here. The Metro is near by as well as shops and restaurants galore. The hotel is very cute with charming decor. The room was small but not too small and had nice touches, like a comfortable bathtub, mini fridge and good storage space. Overall we were very happy here and would stay here again. The staff was also helpful in offering advice on how to get to different locations and on ordering airport transfers for us.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Bertha m
Reviews.Content: my first time in paris and going on my own, this could not have been better for location. the hotel staff are nice, and a special thank you to octavio. i did not eat there as i wanted to soak up the parisian way of life, and there many many cafes on the doorstep. the hotel is immaculate. my own dislike is that the use of colours i thought would make it feel vibrant, but i found it a little dark and claustrophobic, and i did not enjoy spending much time in my room. it would be better to have a room with a view, if there are any. also, on the second floor the rooms are very close together and my neighbours bath time was as if it was in my room! i think perhaps 4 nights here is a little too long. however, paris is of course wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A wee gem”
Reviews.Author: lizziemcc44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2012 for a friends birthday treat. The hotel is ideally located just across the road from the Louvre. Room very clean but often too warm (not a bad complaint). The breakfast we thought was good value as you could choose from sausage and scrambled egg, fresh fruit, yogurts and plenty of breads,fruit juice and as much coffee or tea as you could drink. the staff were very friendly. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near Lourve”
Reviews.Author: Bishan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days with my 9-year. It sits in a quiet side road, but you are steps away from the Lourve and metro. No problems with food and there is a grocery shop nearby. We were given a room on the first floor which required us to maneuver through a long dark passageway that are lit-up by motion-detected bulbs along the way. The feeling can be rather claustrophobic. On the 2nd night, we were moved to a room on the 4th floor as the toilet flush did not work, and thankfully the room was located near the lift. The large windows in both rooms can be opened and you can enjoy the fresh air. Although the bedroom was as expected small, the bathrooms are very clean, spacious and stocked with bathing supplies.The complimentary bottle of French wine in the room is a thoughtful gesture and there are tea making facilities. Staff in the reception is efficient and friendly. We did not regret our choice given the convenience of the location, value for money facilities and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: michele-flynn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located around the corner from Rue St Honore right opposite the Louvre. The rooms are very small, but probably average for Paris. Breakfasts were certainly tasty and you could help yourself. .there were many quaint, little cafes just around the corner as well as an excellent patisserie nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place near the Louvre, Palais Royal, Comédie Française ...”
Reviews.Author: Pierre_Georgette
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near Louvre, Palais Royal, Comédie Française ... Not very far from Notre-Dame ... Service is very friendly ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: marcosdell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, near Louvre, and it's too easy to get the metro or walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cosy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IgorUKBR
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews here on Trip Advisor and I must say that I do not regret it. The hotel sits in a very quiet street literally steps away from the Louvre Museum and it's also very close to the Rivoli Metro Station (about a block and a half away) so in terms of location, it's quite spot on! The hotel is very small but charming and the reception desk was extremely nice and friendly! A special thanks goes to Octavio for being extra nice to us! The hotel has a lift, so that's probably a plus for elders and people with disabilities. The room although really cosy, was a bit too small for my liking. Maybe it would've looked nicer if the room lightning was a bit more efficient. I understand that people might find a darker room more romantic but in my opinion it actually made it seem a bit claustrophobic. Not really an issue, it's more like a matter of personal preference. On the other hand the bathroom was sparkling clean and I also appreciated the fact that the room had a HD TV and a courtesy bottle of wine. There were also a kettle with tea bags (although I don't know if they were free of charge) and a safe, in case you need one. I only wish the mattress and the pillows were better. I think they were a bit too hard and the pillow was a bit difficult to get used to and because of that, I woke up with some neck pain. Breakfast wasn't included and it cost 10 euros per person which we decided to pass, as it only included breads (croissants and things like that), juices, etc... and (apparently) no meats or omelets. To be honest I didn't even bother asking. I understand that Paris may be expensive but I still think that 10 euros for bread and juice is a bit of a ripoff. In general I was very satisfied with the hotel. I think a few points could be improved but overall I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for anything more”
Reviews.Author: heidi h
Reviews.Content: I am a 54 year old woman traveling alone, December 2011. I don't speak french. I am overweight and an hours walk is something I'm proud of. By the end of the day I will be walking in small grandmotherly baby steps. I don't expect France to be America. Just so you have a frame of reference. I chose this hotel for the location, and price while seemingly being "normal" (meaning clean, comfortable, neither budget nor splurge hotel). It exceeded all of my expectations. I arrived at the hotel and was graciously and warmly welcomed by the registrar. I was given a room on the 5th floor. I took the elevator, which I knew would be european (meaning one person, and two pieces of luggage is really the maximum space. They are less than a quarter of the size of an American elevator). Up to the 5th floor and through the fire doors, following the signs to my room. I stopped when their was a small spiral staircase (like you use to climb into the crown of the statue of liberty) which I suspected was narrower than my wide, wide hips and would require more energy than I had to navigate myself and my luggage up. I returned to the registration desk and gently asked if it was possible that there might be a room for me that didn't have stairs to get to it. I was given a room on the second floor without any ill will shown towards me at all. I asked about the free wifi when I check in and was given a code. I have never used wifi in a hotel before and didn't know you needed to open a google window for the username and password box to show up. When I called down to registration he was very kind to explain this to me. The thing was, I had gone ahead and used the wifi with my iphone before deciding i really wanted to use my laptop. The codes are only good for one ip address. (This means if two people are sharing a room you will be sharing internet access on one device too.) I had to call the front desk again (if you're counting, this is now the third time I am bothering this man) to ask why the codes don't work on google. He explained about the one ip address thing and I explain about my cell phone. He kindly, and without hesitation gave me a second code. This hotel has more than one wifi connection. I think I had to call down one more time because when I changed rooms, it changed what wifi I could connect to. So, you can see, I had quickly become a high maintenance guest! All the while, I received nothing but the help I needed and kindness. There is a small bottle of wine in the room that is free. Along with coffee making supplies. There is a television and a mini bar, but I didn't use any of those items to comment on them. Except that the television screen is flat screen and good size, with a remote. The room window opened out onto a wonderful rooftop garden with a fountain in the center. Very Parisian. The window could easily and safely be left open for a cool breeze for the room, or the drapes could be let down to shut out all the light. The double bed was very, very comfortable as were the pillows. They were not flat as pancakes and they were not so foam filled mountainous that they were useless. They were, indeed, perfect. The room is small, being not much empty space between the bed and the furniture. This is not a room you will sit in as if it were a sitting area or a working desk area (although there is a small desk and chair with a mirror where I put on my make up and I must say I look nice, so it worked very well!) The decor is french in that french sort of way with soft blue that seems to be of Marie Antoinette's time. The furniture is heavily painted, and some may think the thick layers of paint odd. I find it charming. The bathroom is oblong and large. The counter corian blues with a single sink. Double bottles of shower gel, shampoo, gentle (and nice!) face soap, que tips, shower caps, and more were laid out. All were freshly replaced the second day, including the soap, which I had only used to wash my face and clearly could have kept using a second day. The towels are small, average towels, but they get the job done. I took baths, rather than showers. The water was hot and plentiful. The water pressure excellent. The bathtub is a bit deeper, but shorter than the normal, average bathtub that I have at home. I loved that on a blustery December day in Paris I could soak in the bath and take the chill from my bones. The room is very quiet. I never heard a sound from person, place or thing. This made for easy and excellent sleeping at any time of the day or night, which is wonderful given that jet lag and body clocks weren't in sync with the actual time. The room was so comfortable, I decided alter my plans and stay another night. The next morning the man at the front desk was kind to call the hotel I had arranged near Versailles so I could cancel that room. I had tried to call myself, but it was a recording asking me to push numbers so I wasn't successful with the call on my own. I was grateful he was so helpful to me. Next, I asked if he would call the Eiffel Tower 58 restaurant so I could make reservations for lunch. I had gotten the number off the internet. He took the number, looked at it and said it couldn't be right. He took the trouble to find the number and make the call. Extraordinary care he is taking of me! ♥ The next morning I plan to see Norte Dame before leaving the city. It is raining fiercely and, of course there is my luggage. He suggests leaving it at the hotel, which was very thoughtful and nice. Next, I ask him to help me cancel a hotel reservation in another city I will not be able to keep tonight. He does that with the utmost grace. I return from my morning to check out. I ask him if he would call a taxi to take me to the RER A line. He does and it arrives before we even have my luggage out. He told the taxi drive where I was going for me. I had stopped at a chocolate shop and bought a box of chocolate truffles for the man at the front desk. The shop put them in a gift bag for me when I explained I wanted to thank the man at the hotel for taking such good care of me. When I thanked the man at the hotel, telling him I knew that I had required more than other guests and I truly appreciated it he seems touched with the gift. He is a genuinely nice man. I can't imagine ever running into someone more helpful. For this alone, this hotel stands out in an extraordinary fashion. The location is wonderful. Even I could easily walk to the lourve. There is a metro station just next to the lourve, so if you are game to travel that way, this is also an excellent location. There are several cafes nearby. Cafe Richard made a good omlette. The reputation of the rudeness of the French is shattered at this hotel. If you are willing to embrace a European experience (and that's why you came, isn't it?) I highly recommend Hotel Louvre Vons Enfants. Well worth the price in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: bluenose1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011. We have previously stayed at the much larger/grand Louvre Hotel slightly nearer to the actual Louvre but found this hotel gave as much peace and quiet and yet still still stayed within our ideal neighbourhood for the price. On arrival the receptionist spoke perfect English and was very welcoming. He showed us various pamphlets and was very knowlegeable about the local area. Our room on the top floor was reached by a small elevator and then a short flight by way of a spiral staircase. Seasoned travellers we always travel light, so small cases are easily transportable. We asked for this room as we had previously read the earlier trip advisor comments from previous guests and it did not dissappoint. A decent sized room (for a city hotel/Paris) with decent amenitites to suit. Our teenage daughter didnt moan anyway - praise indeed!! We didnt take the breakfast offer as there are tons of creperie's, bistros and supermarkets within stones throw from the hotel's area. And with the Euro/GBPound not a great deal away from each others level (per se) it was not a shock to buy some luxury items from the local supermarket and not break the bank. The hotel is situated about two hundreds mentres away from the Louvre Museum but is tucked up a small side street , the street which is only really used during the day for buisiness traffic remains quiet during the evening after all the civic offices' personnel have gone home . After a small wander we found a charming 'square' of gardens (look it up on Google maps). little oasis - brilliant little place - real chill out area after a days out to wind down. All in all the hotel is not a 5 star 'grand' place but certainly makes up for this by being a charming, boutiqe feeling nich'e bolthole. We will return without any fear.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is....”
Reviews.Author: MelandJohn'sholiday
Reviews.Content: Had we not been travelling with a friend it is likely we would not have stayed at this hotel, based on the other traveller reviews and our own personal accommodation preferences. However, we did and I'm pleased to share the good and bad.....which isn't all that bad. The positives: *It is certainly priced right when you're staying in Paris for five nights and opting to stay in a Hotel versus an apt rental. It has a single rate if travelling solo. *Location of this hotel is perfect for accessing the Metro, and it is across the street from the Louvre. BONUS! *It has FREE internet access *Every room has a safe *The Hotel cleaning staff are trust worthy!!! My husband forgot to lock the safe one morning and we came back to find NOTHING missing!! *The front desk staff are also very helpful and do speak english *We did NOT have bed bugs or did the other room our friend was staying in *The curtains are totally black-out (fabulous) *Located on a quiety street - lots of good restaurants around. The Negatives: *The room was dated and really needs a renovation overhaul to really make it clean again. The rooms are clean, daily mopped and dusted and fresh towels (so not dirty in that sense), but the bedroom furniture, paint, bathroom; sink, grout, walls need renos badly. *The bed and pillows; small and ok not plush or luxurious *Our room was actually not a bad size - I was expecting it to be really small based on all the reviews. However, the "single-rate" room our friend was in, just fit the bed and a dresser with access to the bed from one side. That room was very dark and oddly shaped. *Hotel buffet breakfast - not really worth the money unless you're looking for convenience, eat and go. Around the corner you can get fresh eggs and bacon cooked for the same price. *Sound between the rooms carries. Overall, not so bad, not the best, simply ok.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights in Louvre Bons Enfants”
Reviews.Author: GrenadierGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights stay in Louvre Bons Enfants with my partner, it was my first visit to Paris and loved the city but certainly not the hotel. Our room was very small, quite dated but that wasn't the issue, the problem was the bed bugs, my partner got bitten all over his body. He got a large number of bites which were really quite uncomfortable and unpleasent to look at, it took a few days for them to calm down but he still has marks left. The reception staff were the only people we met in the hotel, they did seem nice but they never asked if we needed help with anything or did we enjoy our stay. We can't wait to go back to Paris but it certainly won't be to this hotel. My advise would be if you are looking for a good location then find a hotel near to Louvre Bons Enfants but don't stay in there.

Reviews.Title: “A dirty well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JPCuritiba
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at this hotel last week and we do not like it. First of all, our tiny room was very dirty, with lot of dust all over the roof, near to the A/C system and the doors, and the floor was aldo dirty. To reach our dark room, we had to go by a tiny and dark corridor, by which our luggage almost didn't pass by. The bed and the pillows were terrible, and the pillowcase was also dirty. The tiny toilet was not at the same space of the washroom, and had no suction fan working (there was one, but was not working at all, even after 2 claims at the front desk). The only thing we liked, was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and I would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtravelled1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just yards from the Louvre! The staff was friendly and professional. Rooms were comfortable, and the beds great. The bathrooms were a little tired and could use a regrout around the tubs, but otherwise just fine. Personally prefer a shower instead of bath, but that's just me. We were given the family rooms on the first floor. Breakfast was the usual standard fare. Never had a problem with the hotel, got a great suggestion for dinner from reception. Best meal of the trip. There are several cafes in the area all offering good fare. Karen's tip: Ask for a room above the first floor, the underground (the tube) runs underneath, and you can hear them run until about midnight and start again about 5AM. Suggest you also do a hop on hop off bus tour as they are a great way to see the city highlights. We did the Open tour or tour open ( can't remember which, sorry) If you decide to eat in a cafe/any cafe really, there is a a surcharge to eat outside, usually an extra 2-5 Euros depending on the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hotel. Very clean. Would come back.”
Reviews.Author: welletraveled
Reviews.Content: Everything is a bit small in this hotel, however exceptionally well maintained and clean. We had fully staffed mini-bar and coffee pot in our room. Great locations. I would stay there again without a doubt. There are number of restaurants and coffee places around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: swmarie513
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the Louvre this place is perfect. Sainte-Chapelle and Notre-Dame are also close by. It will take about 45 minutes to an hour to walk to the Eiffel Tower from this location but there are also plenty of buses and taxis. I stayed here a solo female traveler and felt perfectly safe. The front desk was very friendly and spoke to me in English. The room is very tight and there is not a lot of room to move around so if you are planning on spending a lot of time in your room this is probably not the place for you. The matress was not that comfortable but I have found most European matresses are like this. The room had some extra amenities - flat screen TV, soap and shampoo in the bathroom, mini-bar (extra). No A/C but I was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hospitality and value”
Reviews.Author: TinyBusinessman
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in mid July because of Trip Advisor's reviews. This is a small hotel with few rooms and only basic amenities, but for business travel it is of very good value. My room was small but clean and has an efficient layout. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the breakfast good and they even had a small gym for working out. Best of all is the location - it is in 2e very close to lourve, but is also within walking distance to the boutiques in 3e as well as the large department stores such as Lafayette and Printemps.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience but ...”
Reviews.Author: EddieSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly . The room is confortable but small and the location is quite good , few meters from Louvre Museum and from the subway station (Line 1) . This was my first trip to Paris and despite the positive experience with this hotel I would have stayed in another area in London mainly because I didn't like the night environment in this area. I would suggest St Germain area or somewhere close to Champ Elysee for my next trip. A tip to buy tickets for Louvre is to go to Louvre Carroussel a mall in the side of Louvre , where you can buy by credit card tickets to Louvre museum without getting a big line (another option is by internet).

Reviews.Title: “Small but it's enough !”
Reviews.Author: GaspaFer
Reviews.Content: One good think is the localization, because is near a lot of attractions and five minutes from Louvre!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location, but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: Vistar1
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based off of other reviews on TripAdvisor. When we arrived, I was immediately unimpressed. The homeless man directly across the street from the entrance of the hotel (and it's a very narrow street) was the first thing I noticed. Although he had no contact with us, the home he had built complete with liquor bottles strewn about, construction materials from the nearby construction site and a not-so-nice smell was not what I was hoping for in a prime location. The hotel lobby was small, a very gawdy red (just as in the pictures) and the staff was neither welcoming, nor rude...just did their job. When we got to our room, it was small. I mean REALLY small. We have stayed twice in Paris at other hotels and multiple locations throughout Europe and this room by far was the smallest (Room 206). The water closet was separate from the bath and there was just enough room to walk around the bed between the two. The bed was hard, as were the pillows. The bed is a queen bed just in case you were wondering what a "double" really means. The online pictures of the rooms are VERY deceptive as they used a quality wide-angle lens! The room was also very dark, had no view whatsoever and the TV had only 2 non-French channels (which were news channels). The shower was broken in this room as well. After a trip to Monte Carlo for a couple of days, we begrudingly returned to this hotel (tried to cancel, but were inside of the cancellation policy). We were given room 502 this time and although it was significantly bigger, its shower also was not functioning and had the same features as the first room. The wifi is a joke...sometimes it worked, most of the time we could only get one device to log on with a very weak signal. Overall, although it provided a good value, we will choose a nicer hotel next time and pay a bit more for the amenities we can appreciate. At the end of a long day, you want to return to a place that's comfortable and this was not it. But if you are just looking to be in a great location for the least amount of money...ignore the homeless guy, construction, child-size rooms, and hit-or-miss amenities and go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully located, quiet and clean, great value, but characterless.”
Reviews.Author: gladvlad
Reviews.Content: Probably the quietest and cleanest value hotel that I have ever stayed in a major European city. Renovated a few years ago, everything was in excellent working order. Clean hardwood floors are a blessing for allergy sufferers. We had one of the more expensive doubles, but the room was very small, although the bathroom was unusually large for a hotel in this category. Staff were friendly and helpful. Ideally located for walking to major tourist locations on l'Isle de la Cité, and the right and left banks. The immediate street is unattractive, and the hotel decor is bland, modernish and not especially attractive. During our stay a homeless man had set up residence immediately across the narrow street from the hotel entrance. Although he avoided any contact with hotel guests, and seemed harmless, his appearance could put off women and children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: slawoszm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good, excellent. Botlle of wine is a very good start stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Glambert
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel for Paris. As expected the room was small as are the majority of Paris rooms, both the room and the bathroom were very clean. Breakfast was more than adequate and by Parisian standards there was a larger than normal variety of food offered. While our room overlooked other rooms around the courtyard there was no noise from outside to disturb our sleep. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel is very well located near the Louvre. For a budget hotel it rates rather well

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, no frills”
Reviews.Author: pantone292
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very close to metro. Small but tidy room, no frills. Free internet and printing. Can hear (and feel) the metro rumbling, so light sleepers beware. All in all a good value if you can get it for under $150.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: sareif
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants. The location is fabulous especially in January when the weather may be a bit unreliable. The staff is friendly, rooms are clean. It is easy to get to and from CDG. The rooms are small and may be too small for some people. But I can't say enough about the location and the friendliness of the staff. Nice that they WIFI and a terminal for guest use. I love this place and will continue to stay there on my upcoming trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: michele-flynn
Reviews.Content: What a helpful and friendly staff! The room itself was very small, however the bathroom was large and modern (great shower). The hotel's location was superb. Being so close to the heart of Paris made it easy to access many places of interest and there were many nearby cafes and patisseries. The breakfast was amazing and the selection available to eat made it good value for money (not to mention the convenience).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: GHoldup
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel many times. Its location is ideal and the rooms are clean and comfortable, if sometimes on the small side (tho' not for Paris!), and generally quiet, although on the lower floors you can hear the rumble of the metro from about 5.30 onwards. The staff are helpful and friendly. I came to the hotel first of all as they have a workout room, with 3 machines in it. Unusual for Paris for a hotel in this price range & location. Of the 30 or so hotels I've tried in Paris, it probably offers the best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location but rooms too small.”
Reviews.Author: JesterUk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel over the internet and chose it for its location and price. We took a taxi from the station to it and I am glad we did otherwise we would never of found it. It is up a side street and not obvious until you are right on top of it! Our room was on the 3rd floor accessible only by a very small lift and the corridor was so narrow that suitcases had to be took one by one. I was very surprised with the room as it was so much smaller than the photos on the website. I guess they must have a very 'creative' photographer! That said, it was comfortable enough because after all our trip to Paris was to sightsee all day and not to stay in the room! The bed was comfortable but small. O.k for me as I am only 5ft 2in but my partner's feet dangled out the bottom. The bathroom was ample and the water hot (which in my experience is a premium after some the hotels I have stayed in around the world). To sum up the hotel, it was small but comfortable. It was clean and tidy with nice decoration which was in good shape. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. It's location was excellent and within walking distance of some of the attractions, metro stations and restaruants/bars. Would I stay again? Yes of course...

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Lizb21b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Louvre Bons Enfants for the first time last weekend. I am a female and was travelling alone and I found it safe, welcoming and friendly. The location is fabulous and you can walk to many tourist sites; others are a short bus or metro ride away. The staff at the hotel were very welcoming and helpful. My room was small but charming and very clean. There was a complimentary bottle of wine from the hotel which was another nice touch. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: ydnic50
Reviews.Content: A three minute walk to Du Louvre, a half-hour walk to the Notre Dame, a Metro station and an Open Bus Tour stop within minutes -- all this and more makes the location wonderful. With the hotel just off the R. De Rivoli, guests have easy access to fantastic shopping, to enticing cafes, or to the Tulleries for a natural stroll. Not only is the location perfect, but the consierge was friendly, accommodating. He called taxis, confirmed reservations to tours, protected our luggage, helped with directions. Without question he contributed to the positive feelings we have about our stay at the Louvre Bons Efants!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: BobDS
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, the staff is generally helpful, and the location is good

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and cosy hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: brissytraveller_44
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris late in the evening after travelling from Australia. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. As there are no kettles in the room they allowed us to make a cup of tea in the kitchen. The breakfast was fantastic cereal/bread/toast/coffee/juice/yoghurt/meat/cheese etc, it is good value for the price. There is also a bakery and supermarket within 5 mins but b'fast at hotel is great. You can walk to the Louvre and also pick up the openair tour bus. Metro is very close about 400 metres. Rooms are small but if you are out and about all all day it doesn't matter. There is also a lift that services 4 of the 5 floors, to get to the 5th floor you must take a flight of stairs. If mobility impaired there is a room on ground level. It has free wi-fi as well. This is nothing to do with the hotel but the streets of Paris smell strongly of urine, people mostly homeless men, use the streets as a urinal, this is a serious problem for the place. When going to one of the most beautiful cities in the world and it smells bad it is not a good thing, Paris definitely needs more public toilets.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place and good location to saty”
Reviews.Author: BangkokSazy
Reviews.Content: Nice and good service for staff. Nice hotel and very good location. Next time I wll stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A warm and cosy abode in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in September 2010. If i could i would give 6/5 for its location! =) It is a stone's throw away from the louvre museum and the Metro. (even if your granny was the one throwing the stone). But yet, just slightly off the main throughfare for that bit of peace and quiet. Very small rooms though, so not good if you like big spaces. And be prepared to pay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelers51
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is tucked away down a small street so it is quiet but in a great location near the Louvre, restaurants and shopping. The staff at the front desk were always welcoming and helpful and spoke excellent English. Compared to prices at other nearby hotels, this one offered great value. The room was small but probably no smaller than many other Paris hotels. The bath was modern with a good shower. The mattress was a bit hard but I think that is a French thing. Beautiful wood floors and cute decorating. Breakfast buffet was sufficient and service was friendly. There is a computer in the breakfast room guests may use at no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Central, small and quiet”
Reviews.Author: AirFireWater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for a short sightseeing stopover in Paris. Location is great, check in was very fast, and the room was towards the small courtyard so it was very quiet too. The lift, hallways and room was small even for European standards. The lift was max three person - first time I've ever been in a lift with the max number of people. The room was cosy and beds good. Didn't try the breakfast, but had a croissant and a coffee standing (the french way, also much cheaper) in a small bar around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for convenience, cleanliness, and relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: Jude102010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small yet has everything required for a pleasant stay. It is clean with excellent service, is located close to restaurants and the Louve, yet has a quite and relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: silmya
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while sightseeing in Paris. The hotel was very comfortable, breakfast was great, location was also good as it was near all the sights we were there to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, easy on the budget”
Reviews.Author: JAC5280
Reviews.Content: Pros: Near Louvre, good price, good breakfast, free internet, front desk attendants spoke English and were very helpful Cons: Rooms use antiquated keys, linens have seen better days, room safe isn't secured down well, dark side street entrance (though door is locked late at night)

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Location-great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui00
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The room was tiny, but big enough to sleep, shower, and store my clothes for a 5 night stay. The location was FANTASTIC-close to the Louvre, center of everything, lotsof restaurants nearby, and the Metro is 100 feet away. The room was very clean and eclectically decorated. The staff was very polite, courteous, and helpful. The breakfast was "help yourself" and quite hearty. Free computer/internet usage in the lobby. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very,very good experience”
Reviews.Author: alexr0
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - right against Louvre (yes, the metro station closest to the hotel is: "Palaise Royale"! Just feel this fact). Amazingly good staff with fluent English. Now regarding the room - we have got an unusual experience: a triple room on the 5th floor right "under Paris roof". Actually, it is a mezzanine. So, the room was large, with a large bathroom and mighty air conditioner. The last detail is important for those ravelling in high season it was 32C when we stayed in Paris. The fact is on the last floor under the roof we did not feel heat. Breakfast is "French". If you need more - book with "breakfast excluded". Funny, we booked namely this way and then... added breakfast just to save time. Make your choice depending on your morning route. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: justinecd
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing - within minutes of the Louvre, the Comedie Francaise and the Palais Royale. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and pleasant. While we were there, temperatures in Paris were 30 degrees Celsius plus, so the air conditioning in the rooms was incredibly welcome. We didn't need to use it, but there's a laundry service available. The bathrooms were big and the rooms were good-sized, especially for Paris. Breakfast was good and the staff weren't too particular about us arriving for it a few minutes past the time for shutting down. The only disadvantage was the Internet service - the hotel has free WiFi, but it's very patchy and hard to connect to. Would definitely recommend making this hotel your base for any trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “If you've got limited time and a limited budget to see Paris, stay here”
Reviews.Author: KentMillard
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here based on the recommendation of a friend who had stayed here before it was renovated. For a single room, I paid 93 euros for the night. Two things about this hotel: 1) the location is incredible - it's a 5 to 10 minute walk to the Louvre and Line 1 of the metro; and 2) the lobby and room that I stayed in was up-to-date and quite nice. One clarification: When I checked-in, the clerk upgraded me to a 250 euro/night room with 2 flat screen TVs; a huge, elliptical-shaped bathtub; a very comfortable, queen-sized bed; and air-conditioning. The room was definitely on the small side but quite plush and quiet. If I spent that kind of money on a hotel room, I might be tempted to book that room. So while I can't vouch for the quality of the 93 euro room, I can vouch for the location, and the staff. If I'm in Paris for a limited time and won't be renting an apartment, I would stay here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CodysTravels
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Metro, easy walking to many attractions, shops & restaurants. Very helpful staff and the room was very clean, bathroom looked to be recently renovated. After touring around UK and Europe for 6 weeks this was a great restful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff made everything pleasant”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust060
Reviews.Content: We stayed an The Louvre Bons Enfants for five nights. Every one of the staff was so pleasant and helpful. There were directions and recommendations as well as attention to anything we needed in the room. The air conditioning was not working when we checked in and it was immediately looked at and corrected. Everything was very clean and there were enough thick towels for all of us and they were changed daily. The beds were a little hard and the pillows a little thin, but not more so than others we stayed in during our tour through France. The location was in the center of everything yet on a quiet side street. The breakfast was more than just croissants and bread - yogurt, fruit, cereal etc. I would definitely stay here again - it was one of my favorite small hotels ever.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: KatieSharon
Reviews.Content: My husband and our friends, a couple our age (late 20's), agonized over which hotel to choose. The hotel's website said they only had one double room left, but when we called they told us they had two available and we were able to book the room over the phone at 4 in the morning Paris time! We were delighted with the results of our choice. The hotel staff was courteous and friendly. The hotel was very clean and in great condition. The beds were comfortable. The shower/bath combo suited us just fine. It had just the "small local flare" we were looking for. The rooms, elevator and hallways are small, but that's a city hotel for you. Overall it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “a very charming french hotel”
Reviews.Author: Popkena
Reviews.Content: great location for culture sightseeing&shopping. perfect for exploring the right bank of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ismail_NewYork
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel from May 23rd to May 28th. We were in Paris for the French Open and also for some sight-seeing. We each stayed in a single room. The hotel is within 5 minutes to the Louvre and is central to many eateries and stores. It's about 10 minutes from many of the luxury shops on Rue Saint Honoré. The metro is also right in front of the Louvre. You can catch the 1 and 7 lines. You can take the 1 line to Champs-Élysées - Clemenceau and change to the 13 line to Invalides and catch the RER C5 train there to the Palace of Versailles. My friend and I did this and the trip took only about 45 minutes each way. Very convenient. Aside from the great location, the reception staff were the nicest and most helpful team of people I've ever met at a hotel. They deserve a raise for their patience with us for all the questions we asked. They just have a great attitude that puts you at ease. Now to the rooms... The single rooms were very small. But, typical, by European standards. The walls were quite thin as you can hear conversations in the rooms next to yours. My friend was not too lucky during one of the evenings as she was kept awake by a very loving couple. :) The rooms had the very basic amenities, which was fine since I only needed to go back to the room for some rest and sleep. The floors could have been swept a little bit cleaner as there were some dust bunnies on the floor in my room. The bathrooms are clean, but very narrow and small. I felt like I was doing contortions in the shower stall as it was literally about 2 ft by 2 ft! It was horrible trying to pick up the bar of soap or bottle of shampoo I dropped on the floor. The hotel has a small fitness center with a weight machine, an elliptical, and a rower. It was cozy... just think of it as your personal gym, especially when you are the only one in there. The hotel also offered basic buffet style food (croissant, yogurt, fruits, cereal, juices, coffee, and other beverages) for breakfast at a reasonable rate of 10 EUR. My friend and I also ate at a Brasserie du Louvre at the Hotel du Louvre, which is right in front of the Louvre. The food was very good there, but quite costly... about 28 EUR per person for breakfast / brunch. It was buffet style also, but have a very good variety of food. Overall, I would still rate the hotel to be a 4-star for its location and staff. I also like the free wireless internet service. Just be sure to ask the reception staff for the ID and password.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: dav4844
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel (formally known as Hotel le Loiret) April15 - 18 and the 25. The whole experience was wonderful and just what we were looking for in a small french hotel. The staff was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable with our requests making the stay very memorable. As good as the hotel is, the location is it's most important asset. A 5 min walk and you're at the Louvre, Palais Royal and the Tuileries with the Opera area a 15 min walk. Right around the corner from the hotel are a number of cafes, restaurants and bakeries yet the hotel is located on a quiet street. We would definitely return for another visit to Paris and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Staff but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Adz85
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is perfect for people who want to be smack bang in the middle of things. The staff all speak english and are happy to help. The hotel provides a free internet connection both through WIFI and the communal computer in the breakfast room on the bottom floor. The breakfasts were minimal and probably a little expensive for what they were but the convinience can be worth the extra cost. The rooms are quite small (but then so are most in Paris) but have nice flat screen TVs and brand new bathroom. The room I was in was a little noisey due to traffic and people outside but keeping the window closed blocked most of it out. The hotel is 10 steps from a strip of restaurants and probably 25m from the nearest metro station and 300m from the glass pyramids of the Lourve Museum! I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amykid
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and I was trying to find a hotel that seemed to be in the middle of Paris and had a reasonable price. We couldn't have gotten luckier. Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants is a little quirky but very charming and very quiet. It's located on a small side street of the Rue St. Honore one block from the Louvre and the Louvre/Palais Royale Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location - this hotel had it.”
Reviews.Author: Marge-and-Homie
Reviews.Content: This hotel suited us very well - close to a metro station, close to many cafes and attractions, in the heart of the city. We ended up walking to many places instead of taking the metro. We would advise you to Google the location before going as the street doesn't show up on most printed street maps. Also, we couldn't figure out how to get cold air out of the air con. We just opened the window for a breeze, but this could be unbearable in the height of summer. But all in all we were very pleased with the hotel and had a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: SilveiraJr
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very good services. Rooms have one problem: The beds have wheels underneath that prevent you from leaning back to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Proddella
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and a fantastic location, the cleaner even put my wedding bouquet in a vase unasked - very kind of her. Would thoroughly recommend. My only niggle would be perhaps they shouldn't renew the soap everyday though as it's not very environmentally sound!

Reviews.Title: “Darn that volcano!”
Reviews.Author: Tom60745
Reviews.Content: My flights to Paris and Toulouse were cancelled. Unable to stay at Hotel. Stayed there several times in the past and loved being there. Great location and great staff. Will stay there again the next time I'm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “3 night visit in a small charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy019
Reviews.Content: As a single traveller i had a small room but it had a comfortable double bed with tasteful decor. The location is close to the Louve Museum and also walking distance to "Paris City First" which is a day tour company (i did a great tour of the Loire Valley with them) The hotel staff are friendly and most helpful. Breakfast is basic but adequate. Only thing i really missed was not being able to make a hot drink in my room. There was a small fridge in my room which was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages...”
Reviews.Author: SydneyOzcouple
Reviews.Content: Location...location... location! The room was very small but comfortable, clean and charming. The price was small too, considering it's fantastic location for exploring paris. If you want to sit in a 5 star luxury suite then this is not for you, but if you want to get out and see the heart of paris... enjoy the classic street side cafes and be within easy walking distance of lots of iconic parisian attractions (the louvre 1 minute away) and areas like the latin quarter and then have somewhere comfortable and friendly to sleep as we did, then we think this hotel was perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the downstairs meal and sitting areas ,with free internet access, are spacious and relaxing... hope this helps... enjoy paris

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a short city break”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireCookie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights for a short city break in Paris. The location was fantastic for seeing the sites. Very near the metro and opposite the Louvre, lots of cafe's and restaurants nearby. Staff were very friendly and helpful. You can store your luggage safely after check-out. Hotel was clean and nicely decorated. Rooms are small but everything you need if you're not spending too much time in your room. We were out exploring until it was time to sleep so the hotel was perfect for us and location meant we could easily pop back to change before setting out in the evening. the bathroom was a good size. For the location it is great value for money, would highly recommend for a short city break. we are going back again to Paris and would not hesisitate to return to this hotel second time around.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, with courtesy”
Reviews.Author: laotse1977
Reviews.Content: The staff exhibited a "must have" for tourists: patience with the ones that don't speak French very well, but wish to. They were willing to help with every request I had.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Scout2716
Reviews.Content: Room was a typically European (small), but very clean and amenties included free Wi-Fi. Bathroom was kept clean daily and bigger than expected. Shower curtain was flimsy so it was a bit difficult dealing with that when showering. Main drawback was that the room overlooked the small courtyard and second hand smoke from other rooms always crept into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value for your money & ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2610
Reviews.Content: - Staff very nice and helpful - Perfect situation next to the Louvre and subway station - Very clean - Good size bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: gurudg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a great location, and the rooms are very small but nicely decorated and maintained. The staff was very helpful and went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable. But be aware that the elevator, hallways, and stairways are very narrow, which can be difficult if you have a lot of bulky luggage. I'd definitely stay here again, though!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: alipurdue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last weekend and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is designed in a pleasing quirky style. It was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. The breakfasts were good. The room was smallish but perfectly acceptable and standard in this type of Parisian hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect for accessing all of the city's many attractions on foot or by metro. We would definitely recommend the Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants and would be happy to return there on a future visit

Reviews.Title: “Cute, efficient, quiet hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: JGG10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Trocadero on our way into Europe, and by comparison, this location was so much better - right in the middle of everything. The rooms are definitely small, and the elevator and hallway was unbelievably small. But, the hotel does everything right in a very compact footprint. Even when the elevator broke on the second day, they carried our huge luggage down the stairs for us without any question. Great value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and so clean!”
Reviews.Author: Carrolline
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 2 minutes from Louvre and the Tuileries Gardens. The hotel is spotlessly clean, recently refurbished by the looks of it (Sept 2009). The first room we were in had fabulous bathroom with wet room - only moved so we had more room to hang clothes. Second room had great bathroom with spa bath. Beds comfortable and plenty big enough (obviously bought new ones, so. Would highly recommend. Staff very polite and quietly helpful. Breakfast basic continental, but good and filling. Next door to two good restaurants (not noisy) and three more just up the road. Chemist just a few doors along the road that sells cheap bottled water.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Near all trams etc, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hussey1
Reviews.Content: Good Location, Good Breakfast, friendly staff, very near louvre. Hallways very narrow and room small(think all is that way in Paris)

Reviews.Title: “it`s a very good location”
Reviews.Author: acornejo
Reviews.Content: i just have to say that my shower was the smallest one that I ever had, other than that it's nice, small but confortable and it's in a great spot in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: The rooms are pretty small and there's occasionally a bit of rumble (Metro?), but this is still a nice hotel in a fantastic location and an excellent value. It's right around the corner from the Grand Palais-Musee Louvre stop of the Metro, and within easy walking distance of lots of the sights - most especially the Louvre. The service was also great and the desk staff were unfailingly pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Paris”
Reviews.Author: bellasenzatrucco
Reviews.Content: Our room (and bed) was very small and hot but the hotel is very central and nice. Good staff, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Option”
Reviews.Author: PokaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants was an excellent stay for Paris. As with most rooms in Paris the room was small but it was very adequate and great for a solo traveller. I only paid 100 euros which was great for the location but don't think it would be as good value if paying 150+ euros in high summer. Staff helpful and friendly and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent.”
Reviews.Author: AlexandrT
Reviews.Content: Room was very good, excellent location. Service was good also.

Reviews.Title: “They do care for their customers!”
Reviews.Author: amymoni
Reviews.Content: Location was great for tourist purpose. The staff was very helpful regarding assistance with taxi/airport arrangements. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: ovalfairy
Reviews.Content: If there is anywhere one sould stay in Paris for a reasonable price and a great location, this is it. Lovely staff, right in the centre of Paris. We didn't have breakfast as we were SO close to all the Parisian cafes! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel but with a central location”
Reviews.Author: mccald1
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to use as a base for spending 90 % of your day sightseeing but definitely not for a luxury stay. Flickering light in bathroom was annoying. If you're a large person this hotel may not be for you, lift and hallways are tiny. As I said though, good location, clean, plenty of nice restauarants surrounding it, perfect to use as a base for an avid sightseer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ClareSomewhere
Reviews.Content: This is a cute hotel that has an excellent location, literally 2 minutes walk from the Louvre across the road. The location is the selling point for this place, however the hotel itself is small and cosy. The rooms, as in most Parisian hotels are pretty small, and the one that we had allocated looked directly across into offices with people being able to see into the room! The staff are helpful, and the hotel itself is in good condition. Would recommend it, mainly due to the fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jrwheel
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with very helpful front desk persons. The rooms were small but very clean with nice bathrooms. We had a power outage so no hot water for a while, minor problem. Because of its central location, we did not use the Metro, walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenesaispascolorado
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we expected and were looking for. Moderately priced, it was clean and very basic. The room was tiny, but it did have a private bathroom - always a plus in Paris. The staff was very pleasant, if not able to provide much information about the city. Two blocks from the Louvre, it had an absolutely fantastic location, and it wasn't too noisy considering how urban it was. So, no, this hotel won't knock your socks off, but it will definitely give you a good place to stay while you explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good little base for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Buterbean
Reviews.Content: We felt that the hotel was very well located - easy to find and in the center of most tourist attractions. It was clean and staff were friendly. The only thing you may want to consider before staying is that corridors and the lift are pretty small. It was perfect for a short stay but if you are in Paris for a week or so then I think I would have preferred a little more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmvazq2
Reviews.Content: When I´ll return Paris, I´ll stay at this hotel again. Is one of the best hotels I know.

Reviews.Title: “super convenient for traveller”
Reviews.Author: pariswalker1229
Reviews.Content: best location in paris, walk to Louvre only a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff for the solo traveler”
Reviews.Author: jimsadventures
Reviews.Content: The helpful and friendly staff and the hotel's location - two blocks from The Louvre and right on Metro Lines 1& 7 - were the highlight of this property. The hotel's lobby is large and welcoming, and the adjoining breakfast room is very pleasant. I would also give high marks for the continental breakfast that was available each morning. I will say that the elevator was so small that it is nearly impossible for two adult men with suitcases to ride at the same time, which lead to very slow elevator service. My room was very small compared to others that I have experienced in Paris, and there was very little storage space for clothing during my week-long stay. However, the room was very clean and it did have operable windows with a Juliet balcony. Also, the bathroom was large and clean. Overall, I would recommed the hotel, especially for a single traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Telemon_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel with another couple in late Sept. this year and everything was great. By American standards the rooms are a bit tight, but we have stayed in smaller rooms in other hotels in europe in the past. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, always ready to help out. One comment is that in my opinion 10 Euros for a continental breakfast is a bit expensive. I suggest going right down the road to the bakery and getting fresh breakfast there for about half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_april
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room on the first floor. The room was quite small, but we didn't mind. The room was newly renovated and the bathroom was brand new. It had a jacuzzi (which we didn't have time to use unfortunatly) and was very nice. The staff was helpful and polite. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but ate at some of the nearby cafès. The location is super! The metro station is very close and it takes you whereever you want to go. If you want to go shopping, Rue de Rivoli is 50 meters away. I will definetly stay at this hotel again, if only for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well located, but a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Freitag74
Reviews.Content: The hotel scores on great location, within walking distance of Marais, Latin Quarter, Louvre etc, and great staff. Unfortunatly the room left something to be desired; the air con didn´t work, which was troublesome as our room only had one window with little or no possibility for fresh air or light. All in all a nice hotel, but skip the triple room on the first floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Very kind Staff, Clean Room, Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: skbrandon
Reviews.Content: You won't regret to choose this hotel..No need to explain how good this location is.. Unexpectedly Staffs were very very kind.. (This is stereotype)..

Reviews.Title: “Super little hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: swankyforless
Reviews.Content: I spent a week with a friend at this hotel. We upgraded our room to a triple when we saw the size of the double. More money but worth it. New room was still small. Tub/sink and toilet/sink in different rooms-which was good for two women. Heated towel rack was great. It was clean everyday. Very narrow hallways and super small elevator. Had to ask for washcloths multiple times at front desk. Front desk people were very helpful on all shifts, getting us washcloths, directions, etc. Location was perfect. Easy to get everywhere both by Metro and walking. Several cafes very close by. Metro and Louvre a block away. Good value for money. This is not my first visit to Paris- would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, a stone's throw from the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: silvergrrl
Reviews.Content: A charming place that is ideally located for discovering various areas of the city, experiencing culture and shopping. Professional, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Louvre”
Reviews.Author: Jasdoe
Reviews.Content: Small room, as seems be the norm in Paris and London, but well kept and in great location on a quiet side street within 2 minute walk of The Louvre. Continental breakfast was well supplied and fresh, good value and very convenient to get an early start. Free WIFI was very convenient, especially for figuring out Metro/RER Routes. Palaise Royal - Musee Louvre RER station is only 1 minute walk and Paris transit is incredibly easy to use, just remember to take the elevators in stations where they are offered.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: travelbaby82
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my two nights at this hotel. It was my first stop on my first trip to Europe and as a solo traveller it was important to me that I stayed somewhere comfortable and well located so I could get my bearings and start my holiday well. The room was cute and cosy with a comfortable bed and the bathroom was very clean and a good size. Staff were friendly and helpful. I would definetly choose to stay there again and would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ShannonMA
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel - particularly for value and the location. The room we had was small - but then again it is an old Parisian building, and this is what you must expect for the type of architecture the area of the city and the price of the room. Its right in the middle of Paris - perfect! It was clean, quiet and the staff were friendly - as friendly as any other Parisian! The culture of the people, art, food, architecture is just on the doorstep of this great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: rplyler1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre Bons Enfant was excellent what we wanted for our trip to Paris. The room as small but large enough for what we needed it for - sleeping. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. The AC worked well and was great to come home to at the end of a long day walking about the city. The location of this hotel is ideal. We were within walking distance from almost everything. Finally, the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a cheaper hotel is Paris - a place without a lot of frills but still perfect for travelers. 5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -- Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Lori088
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor facing the courtyard and the room was quiet. The hotel is renovating the reception area and it should look great when finished. Reception was helpful and friendly. Room is small but normal for Parisian standards, bathroom good size. Would stay again and it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ZitaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We loved it, price/performance is just super and everybody is so helpful. We will be back,

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Youngcouple7879
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid June for 7 nights for our honeymoon. It was a great little hotel, very clean and easy to get to from the train stations. Location of the hotel was good, right near the louvre museum and close to shops, lots of cafes and a safe area at night time. We had a night time bus from moulin rouge drop us nearby and had to walk back to the hotel (about 3 blocks) at 2am and I felt really safe. Rooms were clean and had everything that we needed. They were small however this is common in Europe. Our room was on the 3rd floor and was really quiet, however the elevator was small - big enough for 3 people so not great if you don't like small spaces - but the stairs were an easy option. Free computer and internet access, you leave your key at reception each time you leave the hotel - this is also common in Europe. Very friendly english speaking front desk staff, had great maps and brochures at the desk that had various tours around paris. Great little laundry-mat near by and close to designer shops if you feel like shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: olddog55
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, close to metro and Louvre Musem. Good cafe's and shopping in the area. Rooms are small, but clean and the bathroom was great.,lot's of hot water for three generations of females! Staff pleasant and helpful. We all would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricFromOK
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 3 nights as part of a larger trip celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary. We found the hotel easily and it's conveniently located a block off the Metro and two blocks from the Louvre. The area around the hotel has plenty of choice for restaurants and cafes, so it's a good choice for someone with a few days to spend. The rooms at Hotel Louvre Bon Enfants are small, like nearly every other hotel in Paris. Don't let it ruin your trip--you're there to see the sights, not live in your hotel room. The bed was not particularly comfortable, but that's because we were two adults accustomed to a US-style king bed trying to fit in a twin bed. If either of us were staying in the room alone, we wouldn't have had anything to complain about. The shower delivered hot water to ease the pain of feet walking all over town. The staff were friendly and greeted us by name after the first day. They were doing some renovations to the downstairs area while we were there, but it didn't cause us any problems. From our rooms, even with the interior windows open, we couldn't hear any street noise. Definitely a good location and a pretty good room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, loved the location,”
Reviews.Author: sodermoto
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, loved the location especially. It was literally like a block away from the Louvre. It was amazing. The rooms were great, but our room could have used about 6 more inches so that we didn't have to pick up our huge suitcases to get from one side of the room to the other. (it fits as a perfect European hotel.) The front desk people at night didn't speak English so that was a little difficult (and was literally the only draw back)(I guess there was one more drawback and that was that the bed in our room was noisy when you sat on it. (it sounded like a dog barking)) Would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chile_elm
Reviews.Content: I loved the boutique feel of this little hotel. It is close to many cafes and brasseries as well as the metro station and attractions. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, a few small problems”
Reviews.Author: Gingermegs79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on our return to Paris (stayed on the left bank previously) in the conveniently located Louvre Bons Enfants. We had booked over the internet in May prior to leaving Australia, and no mention was made of renovations being underway. However, when we arrived there was work going on adjacent to reception and painting though the rest of the hotel if the smell throughout the 3rd floor (we were room 306) was to be believed. The room itself was nice, and decent size by Paris standards, very clean and it was nice to be able to open the window for fresh air, especially given the paint fumes! We were really there to be out and about but the one service we were interested in was wifi access, which the hotel supposedly offered for free. However, reception in our room was variable. My husband ended up leaning half out the window trying to check his email and the connection kept cutting out. We were back and forth to reception trying different codes, but the problem was signal strength in our room. Room 306 was right in the back corner so maybe not a problem with the other rooms. We then tried using it in reception where it was completely out of order the next morning, so we gave up and used internet at cafe's etc We didn't ask to move given our brief stay and we really couldn't be bothered packing and repacking. We had the breakfast on the morning we were leaving for the airport - it was self service buffet style, ok but not the best we had on our trip. Overall, I would stay again but ask for a front room and check what the status of renovations are would be my tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ELIB1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, the staff were wonderful and so helpful. The rooms are small but very clean and the location of the hotel is excellent, about a 2 minute walk to the Louvre and the metro station. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: SundayGrundle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only one night but loved the location. Hotel is in a great area just behind the Lourve...very central so its the perfect hotel to base your Paris adventure from. Rooms are very small but cozy and really all we needed for 1night. Staff were very friendly and always willing to help. Didn't have the breakfast but really do you need it in Paris? with all the baguettes and crepes on every street corner:) Overall a really nice short stay in Paris made a lot easier by this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent PQR & location”
Reviews.Author: jpc36
Reviews.Content: While smack in the very central & busy Louvre-Palais Royal area, this hotel is located in an amazingly quiet small street. The staffpersons are all welcoming and efficient. Rooms are small but air-conditioned, bathrooms very clean and satisfactory. Excellent neighborhood amenities, incl. a 7/7 - 24/24 post office 2 blocks away where foreign currency is exchanged.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sukibaz
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Paris and we did a lot of research about where to stay on Trip Advisor, and we were VERY pleased with this hotel because of the location. You are steps from the Louvre Rivoli and Louvre Palais metro stops, and within easy walking distance to the major areas (Louvre, Jardin de Toulerie, Champs Elysee, St Germaine, Notre Dame, Pompidou Centre, Eiffel Tower, Catacombs). Its true that the rooms are small, the walls are thin, and the elevator was hilariously small, but the staff were friendly and the breakfast was super convenient and tasty. The price was a bit steep for the room size, but the location and convenience makes up for it! If you are night-owls like us you'll find that the restaurants nearby close early, but check out Le Fumoir for a late-night drink and snack--its right near the Louvre Rivoli metro stop and across from the eastern end of the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel, excellent position”
Reviews.Author: poetanon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants is a small hotel with small rooms in an excellent position 2 minutes from the Louvre. Although in such a central position the hotel is in a quiet and small side street, so small it wasn't named on the maps of Paris I had. The room we had was at the back of the hotel and was quiet. Very clean and comfortable, very friendly staff. I suppose it could be described as basic, as it doesn't have ameneties such as pool or gym - but if you are in Paris to see the sights you are going to be out & about, not staying round the hotel. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has a good location and is small and charming, though stil in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: slc2009
Reviews.Content: If you goal is to explore Paris and particularly to see the Louvre, this is the location for you. The hotel is small and so are the rooms, but they are adequate and cute. The staff was helpful. Though breakfast wasn't included the staff discounted mine because I had such a small one! The rooms are quite small but perfectly adequate for sleeping. Mine was on the 4th floor and looked out over a small, quiet inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “A First Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: JJD46
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first visit to Paris, we did not spend much time in the room However, it was very comfortable with a roomy ,modern bathroom. TV stations are mostly French which was a treat to see some familiar shows with French dialog! CNN is the only English program. All the sights are very close and walkable, or the busses and the metro are conenient. The hotel staff was very helpful and even printed out our journey when we asked. Since the hotel is centrally located, we just chose a different direction each day and walked out. The views are stunning and the people are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Locations!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_from_Singapore
Reviews.Content: The best of this hotel is good location - near to Metro and train station. The room is also clean although is small. Depending on individual but for me clean is more important. The staff is very friendly. We ask for the nearest available local supermarket, and then he provided us with a map and clear instruction to get there. Kettle for coffee making is not available in the room but you can get it at the ground level near the small kitchen area where the guest have breakfast. For me this is the only inconvenience, however I could bear with this as it is freely accessable and self-service. Overall, we like this hotel and will stay here if we go Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and intriguing”
Reviews.Author: Maurizio1964
Reviews.Content: Nice walks and many monuments very close to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Campo11
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent as it was very central (just behind the Louvre Museum) to all the main tourist attractions. Easy access to all the transport services such as metro stations, boats, busses, etc. The rooms are not that luxerious but are acceptable for a short stay. Rooms were tidy and clean. The biggest highlight (not being French speaking) was the continuous support from the staff. Ordering taxis and shuttles, advice on attractions, etc. were very helpful to make my stay a wonderful experience. I'll definitely make use of this hotel in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, nice rooms but small, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MOMAtteo79
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just for one night , the hotel is very well positioned and near a metro, the louvre and other interesting places. Unfortunately the metro runs is under the building i suppose and with the room at first floor you can hear clearly when the train passes.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: PortlandPeg
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights and had a wonderful time. Our triple room was small but we expected that for central Paris. The room was exceptionally cleaned each day. The front desk staff were terrific. They remembered us each time we returned and were very helpful will suggestions on sightseeing and dining. Their English was wonderful as our French was very limited. The hotel is basic but its a three minute walk to the Metro and under ten minutes to the Louvre. Couldn't have asked for a better location! I recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value central and comfortable spot”
Reviews.Author: SAust
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Louvre des Bond Enfants is in a great spot right near the Louvre. The rooms are quite cosy, but not too pokey. They are very clean and comfortable and have everything in you need both in the room and in the bathroom, including some storage space for your luggage and clothes. The breakfast each morning is also done very well.

Reviews.Title: “QUICK GETAWAY ...EXCELLENT SERVICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: citymimi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good choice. It was extremely clean and well placed. The staff were excellent and friendly, even calling places for me in French (as I speak nil) to arrange appointments at spas etc. The location was superb, you walk from the metro, cross the road and voila. However myself and my partner chose to walk places to take in the paris scenery. The only thing that out me off was the price of £170 for double per night. Im more of a Hilton hotel type gal and thought for the price I was going to pay why not upgrade to Hilton. So I was wavering between the two. In the end I decided to go for this one. The rooms were also small but I am aware that this is normal size for boutique hotels double rooms. And the air conditioning was not working, I also heard others in the hotel complain about this, but in all fairness I did not mention this to hotel staff as it did not bother me that much and we just came back to sleep. There was so much to do in Paris. Overall I would recommend this hotel as it is quaint and charming. The room actually felt homely as though we were staying in someone's guest room -and not an artificial environment like some bland hotels. And final point, the bathrooms were immaculately clean. I would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely "petite" hotel”
Reviews.Author: DulcineaWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Everything's tiny in this very charming hotel. It's the perfect location i.e. the Louvre is right across the street, fabulous cafes along the street, the Seine is a short walk away, etc. The hallways and elevator are very narrow and you can barely fit but it's a scream. They serve a lovely continental breakfast for 10 euros and that's the best you're going to get. The staff is absolutely exceptional! I loved them. They will assist with anything you need and their English is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the City of Lights!”
Reviews.Author: Echo42494
Reviews.Content: Finding a hotel in Paris is more than a notion; with so many to choose from, it can be a little overwhelming! I was absolutely thrilled to find Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants, and owe a great big thanks to TripAdvisor.com and the site's users whose reviews of this hotel helped me make the decision to book. Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants was wonderful! I arrived in Paris around 9AM and was a little nervous that the hotel wouldn't let me check in, but as soon as I arrived at the front desk I was greeted and handed my key. The hotel is literally right across the street from the Louvre, and is flanked on all sides by shops large and small, great cafés and restaurants, and other terrific Parisian spots. Getting around the city from the hotel was a breeze; the hotel is a few steps away from the Metro station, and several busses service the area. The hotel room was tiny, yes, but it was comfortable, clean, and quiet. And I kind of liked the fact that I was given a real key instead of a key card--nice "ol' skool" touch. The bathroom has a good-sized bathtub in case you want to take a bath rather than a shower, the bed was comfy, and the décor bright and stylish. The elevator (there is only one) and the corridors are a bit tight and narrow, so keep that in mind when packing. It may be easier to maneuver a couple smaller bags than one big bag like I had! Lastly, the hotel staff was absolutely wonderful! Always friendly and extremely helpful, I felt welcome and right at home during my entire four night stay. All in all, the Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants is a terrific value and definitely a place I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “if rooms were bigger, it would be a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ab_world_traveller
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff, great location. Rooms are small but very clean and updated. The receptionist actually told us that the hotel was recently sold to a new owner and he remodeled the entire place! Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kee2124
Reviews.Content: I've benn to Paris several times before and always had a very hard time explaining the location of the hotel to taxi drivers. This hotel is located right next to Palais Royal which I can pronounce easily and less than 1 minute walk from Metro station. Furthermore rental cycle station is just around the corner which I strongly recommend using when you hang out in paris. I enjoyed riding those bicycles at night cruising along the Seine. Interior of the room is vivid but somehow it's warm & cute so I could feel their hospitality. Some reviewers said their rooms were too small, yes, the room I stayed was compact but it's like all other small hotels in Paris. It didn't bother me at all because there are ao many things to do outside the hotel when you're in Paris....I use hotels to get some sleep when I travel. Not to live. So as long as I can get a good sleep and a hot shower (water pressure and temperature are marvelously stable comparing to other 3star-hotels in Europe) , the size doesn't matter. Front staff were very kind and helpful, except one guy on the nightshift .He corrected my French SARCASTICALLY and told me to quit smoking when I asked him if I could smoke in the room. One night he gave me a wrong key so I went back to the front desk. He didn't say ANYTHING, just handed the key to me so I demanded not an apology but at least to say something from him then he started mumbling in French and gave me a sausy look. But, overall, I think Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants is a great place to stay especially if you are a woman who wishes to feel the ESPRIT of Paris and the warmth of the small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: MIlanoItaly
Reviews.Content: We had a very short stay so the hotel was perfectly located in order to enjoy at best the beautiful city.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Louvre Bons Enfants
HotelInfo.Address: 5, rue des Bons Enfants | 1st Arr., 75001 Paris, France
